definition: Ming Dynasty (1368-1644)/surname Ming/Ming (c. 2000 BC), fourth of the legendary Flame Emperors, 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
bright/opposite: dark 暗[an4]/(of meaning) clear/to understand/next/public or open/wise/generic term for a sacrifice to the gods
to substitute/to act on behalf of others/to replace/generation/dynasty/age/period/(historical) era/(geological) eon

sentences.english: During the years of Jiajing in Ming Dynasty, a scholar named Fan Qin had a hobby in collecting books.

sentences.english: My favorite book is the romance of The Three Kingdoms by luo guanzhong in Ming dynasty.

sentences.english: Dongshi Shu is a historical book that records how the Ming Dynasty managed Liaotung.

sentences.english: In the private compilation of the mid and late periods of Ming Dynasty, there appeared two schools of solemnness and wittiness.
sentences.chinese: 明代中後期的私人修史，形成嚴肅與諧趣兩種流派。

sentences.english: Compendium of Materia Medica recorded 9 kinds of medical amphibians can be used as medicine.

definition: the early Ming (i.e. from second half of 14th century)
late Ming/first half of the 17th century
late Ming and early Qing/around the middle of the 17th century
late Yuan and early Ming/mid 14th century
Jin Dynasty (1115-1234), founded by the Jurchen 女真[Nu:3 zhen1] people of North China, a precursor of the Mongol Yuan Dynasty
the final years of the Ch'ing or Qing dynasty/China at the turn of the 20th century
